definition: to urge/to press/to prompt/to rush sb/to hasten sth/to expedite

sentences.english: No surprise, then, that motor manufacturers have been urging the EPA not to allow E15 on the forecourt.
sentences.chinese: 車商正催促環保局不要批准E15上市一點也不奇怪。

sentences.english: A bugle sounds. The soldier yearns to stay with Lili, but the bugle calls again.
sentences.chinese: 可是號角聲再次響起，催促着他。

sentences.english: He'd hustle all six of us kids out to the backyard.
sentences.chinese: 他催促我們六個孩子來到後院裏。

sentences.english: The jockey urged his horse to run faster.
sentences.chinese: 騎師催促他的馬讓它跑地更快。

sentences.english: Wild, urged the teng village virus samples, was rejected.
sentences.chinese: 野夫催促着騰村交出病毒樣本，遭到拒絕。

sentences.english: I hustled the children off to school.
The captain harried the quarter master for recognition manuals .
sentences.chinese: 艇長催促航信士官給他識別手冊。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold smell speech secretly urged QinQiong show identity.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金聞言暗中催促秦瓊表露身份。

sentences.english: The Shavepate had urged her to put the man to death.
sentences.chinese: 剃頭之人不斷催促她判處男人死刑。

sentences.english: Yan Jing Ke suspected Prince an excuse to delay repeatedly urged innuendo .
sentences.chinese: 燕太子懷疑荊軻藉故拖延，多次暗諷催促。

sentences.english: If progress is to be made, it will have to be at a far slower pace than Global Zero is urging.
sentences.chinese: 如果真有進展，那也是遠慢於全球零核催促的步伐。

sentences.english: Please hasten them to send the sample.
sentences.chinese: 請催促他們把樣品發過來。

sentences.english: Your pain and your hunger, they're drivin' you home.
sentences.chinese: 你飽嘗的苦楚和睏乏，催促著歸家的腳步。

sentences.english: FSH spurs egg maturation in ovary.
sentences.chinese: FSH催促卵細胞在卵巢的成熟。

definition: to urge/to press/to prompt/to rush sb/to hasten sth/to expedite
to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
to rub lightly/to move slowly/to dawdle/to dillydally/to pester/to nag
to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
to question closely/to investigate in detail/to examine minutely/to get to the heart of the matter
